item.title: Higher order functions over collections in Go
item.description: As a newcomer to Go with a background of functional programming, one of my first questions was “are functions first class citizens in Go?” followed by the next question: “are there any implementations of higher order functions over iterables such as map, filter, or fold/reduce?” For reasons beyond the scope of this blog post, there is no standard implementation of this pattern. However, it’s very simple to write your own little functional toolbox:

About me Hi, I’m Sergio. I’m a Software Engineer based in Waterford, in the south-east of Ireland (up the DÃ©ise!) and working at Red Hat. I created this blog to share some knowledge on software development and, in the process, maybe learn a bit more. The purpose of this blog is primarly about programming, but I can’t promise I won’t add some extra stuff in the future. I’ll have to promote my EP somewhere!
